task_summary: Open the pot (remove lid), move the pot onto the plate, then grasp the spatula tool and push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows a small pot with a lid, a round plate, and a spatula-like tool. The robot must first remove the pot’s lid, then grasp the pot and place it onto the plate. After releasing the pot, the robot switches to tool use: it grasps the spatula and performs a controlled push on the pot to translate it toward the table’s front. The plan emphasizes reliable perception, stable grasps, and short, safe motions with binned parameters.
preconditions: Workspace clear of obstacles on the pushing path
Pot, lid, plate, and spatula visible on the table
stepwise_plan: Perceive the pot and open it by removing the lid.
Compute and execute a top grasp on the pot.
Place the pot onto the plate and release.
Perceive and grasp the spatula tool.
Push the pot toward the front with the spatula, then set the tool down.
success_criteria: Pot rests stably on the plate
Pot translated toward the table front by the specified push
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: re-run DetectObject and re-approach
Unstable grasp: reopen gripper, recompute grasp pose, retry
Push misalignment: re-detect pot and adjust approach before pushing
task_long_description.termination: End when the push completes and the tool is placed down with gripper opened.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perceive named target within time budget.
Open the specified container; here, removing the pot lid.
Plan a grasp and store its pose under a blackboard key.
Execute a grasp at a stored pose.
Place object on a named surface/area.
Back off to clear the object.
Use a grasped tool to push a target.
Put the named object down on the table.

assumptions: OpenContainer('pot','pot') corresponds to removing the lid as seen in frames.
Push direction_deg=180 is assumed to be toward the table front in this setup.
Plate is the round beige disk; spatula is the small slotted tool on the left.

expected_success_criteria: Pot translated toward front after push
